message.content: This question requires basic knowledge about the auditory system and how sound is perceived by the ears. When a song is played, our ears perceive the rhythm of the music. Option (A) is incorrect because our ears cannot physically change the source of the sound. Option (B) is incorrect because our ears do not have the capability to rearrange the pitch of the music. Option (C) is unrelated to how our ears perceive sound, as humming the tune involves vocalization rather than auditory perception.

This question requires basic knowledge about the auditory system. When a song is played, our ears perceive the rhythm of the song. Option (A) is incorrect because our ears cannot change the source of the sound. Option (B) is incorrect because our ears do not rearrange the pitch of the song, they simply perceive it. Option (C) is incorrect because humming the tune is something that we can do with our vocal cords, not our ears.

When a song is played, our ears pick up the vibrations in the air and send signals to the brain, which allows us to perceive the rhythm of the song. Option (A) is incorrect because our ears cannot change the source of the sound. Option (B) is incorrect because our ears cannot rearrange the pitch of a song, although they can perceive different pitches. Option (C) is incorrect because humming the tune requires vocal cords, not just the ears.
